sub_topic: Identifying the isomorphism between two graphs.
message_1:
Consider the two graphs G and H shown below. Determine whether they are isomorphic or not.

```
  G                 H
  /\                /\
  ||                ||
  \/                \/
  O -- O            O -- O
  |    |            |    |
  |    |            |    |
  O -- O            O -- O
```

If the graphs are isomorphic, provide an isomorphism between them. If they are not isomorphic, provide a brief explanation why.
message_2:
The graphs G and H are isomorphic. This means that there exists a one-to-one correspondence between their vertices such that the edge structure is preserved.

Here is an isomorphism between G and H:

Let the vertices of G be labeled as G1, G2, G3, and G4, and the vertices of H be labeled as H1, H2, H3, and H4.

```
  G                 H
  /\                /\
  ||                ||
  \/                \/
 G1 -- G2          H1 -- H2
  |    |            |    |
  |    |            |    |
 G3 -- G4          H3 -- H4
```

The isomorphism can be defined as follows:

- G1 ↔ H1
- G2 ↔ H2
- G3 ↔ H3
- G4 ↔ H4

This mapping preserves the edge structure of both graphs, as each vertex in G is connected to the corresponding vertex in H with the same edge connections. Therefore, the graphs G and H are isomorphic.
